ul.li: System Bay 1 houses Engine 1 and a maximum of 10 Disk Array Enclosures (DAEs).
A pair of Standby Power Supply (SPS) modules at the bottom of the rack provides backup power to the vault DAEs. The second pair of SPS modules provides backup power to the engine.
System Bay 1 also houses the Service Processor (Server, KVM, and UPS) Processor that provides software utilities required to service the array.
Power Distribution Units (PDUs) and Power Distribution Panels (PDPs) are located at both sides of the rack and can be accessed from the rear.
System Bay 2 houses Engine 2 and a maximum of 10 Disk Array Enclosures (DAEs).
A pair of Standby Power Supply (SPS) modules at the bottom of the rack provides backup power to the vault DAEs. The second pair of SPS modules provides backup power to the engine.
System Bay 2 also includes the Matrix Interface Board Enclosure (MIBE) that provides inter-engine connectivity in the array.
Power Distribution Units (PDUs) and Power Distribution Panels (PDPs) are located at both sides of the rack and can be accessed from the rear.

span.h: System bay 3 and System Bay 4 (include identical components)

ul.li: System Bay 3/4 houses Engine 3/4 and a maximum of 10 Disk Array Enclosures (DAEs).
A pair of Standby Power Supply (SPS) modules at the bottom of the rack provides backup power to the vault DAEs. The second pair of SPS modules provides backup power to the engine.
Power Distribution Units (PDUs) and Power Distribution Panels (PDPs) are located at both sides of the rack and can be accessed from the rear.
